title: Presidential Nominations and Withdrawal Sent to the Senate, 8/5/10 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
August 05, 2010

 



Presidential Nominations and Withdrawal Sent to the Senate, 8/5/10




NOMINATIONS SENT TO THE SENATE: 
Allison Blakely, of Massachusetts, to be a Member of the National Council on the Humanities for a term expiring January 26, 2016, vice Craig Haffner, term expired.

David B. Buckley, of Virginia, to be Inspector General, Central Intelligence Agency, vice John Leonard Helgerson. 
Cora B. Marrett, of Wisconsin, to be Deputy Director of the National Science Foundation, vice Kathie L. Olsen. 

Donald Kenneth Steinberg, of California, to be Deputy Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, vice Frederick W. Schieck, resigned. 

Juan F. Vasquez, of Texas, to be a Judge of the United States Tax Court for a term of fifteen years. (Reappointment) 
Â 
WITHDRAWAL SENT TO THE SENATE: 
John J. Sullivan, of Maryland, to be a Member of the Federal Election Commission for a term expiring April 30, 2013, vice Ellen L. Weintraub, term expired, which was sent to the Senate on May 4, 2009.
